title: Ocmulgee National Monument: Safety
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Safety            Safety       FOR EMERGENCIES CALL PARK NUMBER (478) 752-8257 PRESS 0 FOR RANGER We will call 911 for you. The ambulance cannot make it past our railroad tunnel to assist in the emergency if you are past the Visitor Center. PLEASE CARRY WATER WITH AT ALL TIMES!  Macon temperatures can reach above 100 degrees in the summer months. Dogs must be on a leash. They are not allowed in the visitor center unless they are a service dog. Park closes at 5:00 pm daily! DO NOT climb on mounds! The average hiking trail is 1 mile; the park has 6 miles of trails. Bikes are only allowed on the park road and our Heritage trail Picnics allowed only in the picnic area No swimming allowed in the Ocmulgee River No drones/unmanned aircraft are allowed in the park
